trans-unit.source: A mathematics library for graphics programming.
trans-unit.target: A mathematics library for graphics programming.

trans-unit.source: For a (barely) complete reference, please take a look at the wiki.
trans-unit.target: For a (barely) complete reference, please take a look at the wiki.

trans-unit.source: GLSL + Optional features + Python = PyGLM
trans-unit.target: GLSL + Optional features + Python = PyGLM

trans-unit.source: PyGLM is a Python extension written in C++.
trans-unit.target: PyGLM is a Python extension written in C++.

trans-unit.source: PyGLM supports Windows, Linux, MacOS and other operating systems with either x86 (32-bit) or x64 (64-bit) architecture,
trans-unit.target: PyGLM supports Windows, Linux, MacOS and other operating systems with either x86 (32-bit) or x64 (64-bit) architecture,

trans-unit.source: All types are initialized by default to avoid memory access violations.
trans-unit.target: Todos los tipos se inicializan por defecto para evitar violaciones del acceso a la memoria.

trans-unit.source: And finally imported and used:
trans-unit.target: Y finalmente importado y usado:

trans-unit.source: Aside from most of the unstable extensions,
trans-unit.target: Aparte de la mayor√≠a de las extensiones inestables,

trans-unit.source: At the same time, it has great performance, being between 2x and 15x as fast as numpy! (see end of page)
trans-unit.target: At the same time, it has great performance, being between 2x and 15x as fast as numpy! (see end of page)

trans-unit.source: Besides the obvious - being mostly compatible with GLM - PyGLM offers a variety of features for vector and matrix manipulation.
trans-unit.target: Besides the obvious - being mostly compatible with GLM - PyGLM offers a variety of features for vector and matrix manipulation.

trans-unit.source: By using GLM by G-Truc under the hood, it manages to bring glm's features to Python.
trans-unit.target: By using GLM by G-Truc under the hood, it manages to bring glm's features to Python.

trans-unit.target: Diferencias con el glm

trans-unit.target: If - for example - you need to use the left handed coordinate system, you have to use *LH, so

trans-unit.source: If a glm function normally accepts float and double arguments, the higher precision (double) is used.
trans-unit.target: If a glm function normally accepts float and double arguments, the higher precision ( double ) is used.

trans-unit.source: PyGLM doesn't support precision qualifiers. All types use the default precision (packed_highp).
trans-unit.target: PyGLM doesn't support precision qualifiers. All types use the default precision ( packed_highp ).

trans-unit.target: PyGLM no soporta las siguientes extensiones y m√©todos,debido a problemas de compatibilidad:

trans-unit.source: PyGLM supports the buffer protocol, meaning its compitible to other objects that support the buffer protocol,
trans-unit.target: PyGLM supports the buffer protocol, meaning its compitible to other objects that support the buffer protocol,

trans-unit.source: PyGLM's syntax is very similar to the original GLM's syntax.
trans-unit.target: La sintaxis de PyGLM es muy similar a la del GLM original.

trans-unit.target: The GLM_GTC_bitfield extension,

trans-unit.source: The function glm.frexp(x, exp) returns a tuple (m, e), if the input arguments are numerical.
trans-unit.target: The function glm.frexp(x, exp) returns a tuple (m, e) , if the input arguments are numerical.

trans-unit.source: The function glm.identity requires a matrix type as it's argument.
trans-unit.target: The function glm.identity requires a matrix type as it's argument.

trans-unit.source: The function glm.value_ptr(x) returns a ctypes pointer of the respective type.
trans-unit.target: The function glm.value_ptr(x) returns a ctypes pointer of the respective type.

trans-unit.source: There is no need to import anything but glm, as it already contains the entire package.
trans-unit.target: There is no need to import anything but glm, as it already contains the entire package.

trans-unit.source: There is no way to set preprocessor definitions (macros).
trans-unit.target: No hay forma de establecer definiciones de preprocesador (macros).

trans-unit.target: This function may issue a UserWarning . You can silence this warning using glm.silence(1) .
